III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
Title qualifications.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It is alleged that Staff 1 gave Youth A oral sex on more than one
occasion.
Investigation I spoke to Complainant 1 and Administrator 1 on 7/16/24. No
new information was provided.
The following interviews were done face to face at the facility on
7/17/24 with DHHS Worker 1:
Youth A reported he did not have any sexual contact with Staff 1.
Youth A reported Staff 1 did not give him oral sex. Youth A
reported Staff 1 has never entered his bedroom. Youth A reported
he did not tell anyone that he received oral sex from Staff 1.
Youth B and Youth C both reported Staff 1 was a good staff
member. Both reported they never noticed her pay more attention
to any particular youth. Both reported she has never entered their
bedroom and has never seen her enter another youth’s bedroom.
Both youths reported they have never seen Staff 1 behave
inappropriately with any youth.
Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C all reported Staff 1 was a midnight
staff member that worked in the morning as well.
Supervisor 1 reported he supervises Staff 1 and has not had any
concerns with her staffing. Supervisor 1 reported he has never
seen her be inappropriate with any of the youth. Supervisor 1
reported he has trained her on appropriate boundaries with youth,
but as a general training that all staff receive. Supervisor 1
reported he has never had concerns about Staff 1’s boundaries
with youth.
2

Staff 1 reported she is a midnight staff member that is sometimes
mandated to work the day shift. Staff 1 reported she does not
enter any youth’s bedroom when they are in it. Staff 1 reported
there are times that she will help clean something in the youth’s
bedroom but will have them leave the bedroom first and then she
will enter. Staff 1 reported she does have a professional
relationship with Youth A as well as the other youth in the pod.
Staff 1 reported at “wake-up” time she opens two bedroom doors
at a time and has the youth clean their room and then when they
are complete, they come out for breakfast. Then she opens the
next two doors and completes the same process. Staff 1 reported
the youth are respectful to her and has not had any youth
attempting to break boundaries or attempt to touch her. Staff 1
reported she has never entered Youth A’s bedroom when he has
been in there. Staff 1 reported she has not given Youth A oral sex
and does not have a personal relationship with him.
There is no video of the incident.
Documents:
• There are no grievances in the file or incident reports
pertaining to this alleged event.
• Staff 1’s personnel file was reviewed and there are no
discipline.
• Staff 1’s training is up to date as well as clearances.
Analysis There is no evidence to validate the allegations. The agency is in
compliance with rule 400.4112(4)(a).
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
